content:
Dear Journal,

It was a dark and stormy night...

You know- that kind of cliched bullshit that you see in a lot movies and TV dramas?

Yeah, well, it happened just like that.

The weather had all gone to shit the past few weeks.

Very little sunlight could be seen shining through constant storm clouds, sending the air around my quaint little town down a spiral of apathy I haven't seen... well never seen before, I should say. With unrelenting rain that never seemed like it was ever going to stop anytime this century, made the ground a muddy, hapless mess that never found time to dry. And you can bet your money's worth that the temperatures was always cold enough to make the rain freezing as fuck but too chicken-shit to actually go down the few degrees needed so we could at least be blessed with some snow! The whole thing has made getting a cold yesterdays news- been there, done that yesterday, and still going strong today!

The complete works- I never thought the sight of rain would sicken me as much as it does now!

... Where was I again?

Oh yeah!

Last night was the freaking worst of them all.

I don't think I've ever heard thunder peal as loud and booming as it did then. The wind was howling madly as well beneath the downpour of rain that pelted my window. Ain't no one sleeping with that racket, am I right!?

... Still, I don't think anyone was expecting that come the next morning, that all that noise had only been the perfect cover for the gunshots that undoubtedly rang that night at the Mayor's home. The screams...

Journal...

... I don't think I've seen so much blood before now, and the whole town seems to be in an uproar at the whole thing, talking about 'old-fashioned mob justice'. I don't know what to do, but I'm not sure what I find worse- the fact that more killing will ensue if the people who killed the Mayor's family isn't found soon, or the fact that the forecast shows no sign of the sun ever touching our fair town again.

- Midnight

Rules:

1.) This game goes by Natural Action Resolution

2.) This is a game, which is supposed to be fun and engaging. So let's keep it as such eh? Keep it civil, no personal attacks please. That doesn't make a game fun for anyone~

3.) Day phases will last 3 weeks, and Night phase no more than 3 days.

4.) Expected posting is at least once every 72 hours. If you don't post in that amount of time, you'll get prodded, and have no more than 48 hours to pick it up and post, before being replaced. 3 prods and you will get forcibly replaced.

5.) Voting is done like this: Vote: Midnight. Unvotes are nice, but certainly not required. I do not count votes unless they are bolded, btw. Sorry.

6.) Lynches take half the players living, plus one. Rounded down when needed. If this does not occur by deadline, then a No-Lynch occurs. Sorry.

7.) A vote for 'No-Lynch' is acceptable. For 'No-Lynch' to occur, half of the living players must vote for it using this; Vote: No-Lynch.

8.) Under no circumstances should anything communicated between you, the player, and me, the mod, by way of PM, QT, or any other form of communication outside the game thread, be quoted anywhere by any means. Modkill on sight.

9.) No outside discussion of this game with players or non-players, or get pummeled to dust as a result.

10.) Once dead, by whatever means, stop posting beyond the single bah post. If you continue to post, you get turned to 'Neutral Survivor', therefore making it an automatic loss for you, regardless if your team goes on to win.

11.) Bold Dark Blue is my color. Use it, and get pummeled to dust.

12.) I will make vote counts as much as I can, probably at least once every two pages.

13.) If I make a mistake, like a wrong vote count or something, please tell me, and I will try to fix it as best I can. If it's a more serious problem, please keep it to PM, and I will try to sort it to the best of my ability.

14.) Flavor- if there is any- has absolutely nothing to do with the game other than being there... but you knew that already, didn't you?

15.) Any of the basic/general MafiaScum site rules I may have missed still apply.

16.) I reserve the right to change/add a rule. In the event that happens, I will inform you in-game.

==================================================================

Dear Journal,

You know what?

It's no amount of wonder to me that we haven't been flooded to our eyeballs yet, what with the rain never letting up for more than an hour at a time.

Mud up to our ankles, certainly! But floods?

Puhlease!

What do you think, Journal?

Anyways, regardless of that, it was with a whole lot of trepidation that wormed its way into my mind as the day went on, all the people shouting and bickering back and fourth with each other in the cold unrelenting rain on the people likely to have done the foul deed.

It seems that a certain number of suspects were gathered quickly- 13 to be exact.

To be honest, though, I don't really recall any of them much, except for maybe a few passing words here and there. Which sucks if you look at it hard enough. I mean, while we certainly no small village, we're by no means large enough to not know people better then that! Somehow I feel shamed to the very core... Funny right?

... Right.

Still, I remember vaguely trying to encourage the town away from enacting 'mob justice' to get rid of the murderer, or murderers however the case may be, responsible for the gruesome death of the Mayor and his family, because it just felt... wrong somehow, you know? But you know the drill, Journal- no one listens to me. Ever.

But then again, it might be more then the usual 'everyone ignore Midnight'. I'm starting to think that all this rain, all this bone chilling cold, and awful dreariness that has plagued the town for weeks has started to chip at everyone's sanity...

Good thing I've always been somewhat slightly insane anyways, hey Journal?

... Oh, wait a minute. I think somethings happening, Journal. Hang on.

...

...

HOLY SHIT!

Are they...!

Are they OUT OF THEIR F-ING MINDS!? They've just... lynched some lady named Natalie. LYNCHED!! I... I didn't think they'd have the guts to do it, but then again with the weather like it is, I should probably keep the shock and surprise at bay until this, whatever this is, blows over- if it ever will that is.

Huh...

So NOW they're bothering to check and see if they got the right gal- after the fact of death.

Brillant. And they say I'm a few straws shy of a bale. HA!

... Well, maybe it's a good thing then, that they got it right this time? If that gun, papers with chicken scratch on them(possibly coded plans? I can't imagine anyone having THAT horrible of handwriting otherwise...) and various weird contraptions is anything to say about it...

But, really. How long can they expect luck to keep them... well us I guess, from killing the innocent?

Well, I guess I can only say, 'Goodnight Journal!', and hope that dawn finds us in better way.

-Midnight
